content: <ce:section-title id="st035">Synthesis</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="st040">Synthesis of {Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(pzbmb)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(I)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>}<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">A mixture of CuI (0.0152<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.08<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), pzbmb (0.0065<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.02<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), acetonitrile (1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) and chloroform (0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was placed in a glass reactor (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL), which was heated at 85<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days and then gradually cooled to room temperature at a rate of 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>. Yield: 65% (based on pzbmb). Elemental analysis (%) <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">18</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>I<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>: C, 30.53; H, 1.85; N, 13.84. Found: C, 30.32; H, 1.72; N, 13.90%. IR (KBr/pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3081(w), 2166(w), 1590(w), 1456(m), 1447(s), 1376(m), 1294(m), 1200(w), 1159(s), 1104(s), 932(w), 747(s), 632(w).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st045">Synthesis of Pt(pzbmb)(Cl)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(DMSO) (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">A mixture of K<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>PtCl<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (0.0083<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.02<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), pzbmb (0.0065<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.02<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), acetonitrile (1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL), DMSO (1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) and water (0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was placed in a glass reactor (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL), which was heated at 85<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days and then gradually cooled to room temperature at a rate of 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C·h<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>. Yield: 65% (based on pzbmb). Elemental analysis (%) <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">19</ce:inf>PtCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>OS: C, 35.77; H, 2.85; N, 14.60. Found: C, 35.58; H, 2.96; N, 14.45%. IR (KBr/pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3096(w), 2167(w), 1672(w), 1519(m), 1452(s), 1332(w), 1283(m), 1206(s), 1134(w), 1043(s), 946(m), 745(s), 657(m).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st050">Synthesis of Pt(pdbmb)(Cl)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0035" view="all">Complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was prepared by a similar procedure as described for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, with the exception that pdbmb (0.0065<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.02<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was used instead of pzbmb (0.0065<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.02<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol). Yield: 70% (based on pdbmb). Elemental analysis (%) <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">19</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">14</ce:inf>Cl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>Pt: C, 38.53; H, 2.38; N, 14.19. Found: C, 38.60; H, 2.51; N, 14.03%. IR (KBr/pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3073(w), 2164(w), 1611(w), 1480(s), 1453(s), 1350(m), 1288(m), 1161(w), 1137(s), 974(m), 779(s), 679(m).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis

Synthesis of {Cu2(pzbmb)2(I)2}n (1)

A mixture of CuI (0.0152g, 0.08mmol), pzbmb (0.0065g, 0.02mmol), acetonitrile (1mL) and chloroform (0.5mL) was placed in a glass reactor (10mL), which was heated at 85°C for 3days and then gradually cooled to room temperature at a rate of 5°Ch-1. Yield: 65% (based on pzbmb). Elemental analysis (%) Anal. Calc. for C18H13Cu2I2N7: C, 30.53; H, 1.85; N, 13.84. Found: C, 30.32; H, 1.72; N, 13.90%. IR (KBr/pellet, cm-1): 3081(w), 2166(w), 1590(w), 1456(m), 1447(s), 1376(m), 1294(m), 1200(w), 1159(s), 1104(s), 932(w), 747(s), 632(w).

Synthesis of Pt(pzbmb)(Cl)2(DMSO) (2)

A mixture of K2PtCl4 (0.0083g, 0.02mmol), pzbmb (0.0065g, 0.02mmol), acetonitrile (1mL), DMSO (1mL) and water (0.5mL) was placed in a glass reactor (10mL), which was heated at 85°C for 2days and then gradually cooled to room temperature at a rate of 5°C⋅h-1. Yield: 65% (based on pzbmb). Elemental analysis (%) Anal. Calc. for C20H19PtCl2N7OS: C, 35.77; H, 2.85; N, 14.60. Found: C, 35.58; H, 2.96; N, 14.45%. IR (KBr/pellet, cm-1): 3096(w), 2167(w), 1672(w), 1519(m), 1452(s), 1332(w), 1283(m), 1206(s), 1134(w), 1043(s), 946(m), 745(s), 657(m).

Synthesis of Pt(pdbmb)(Cl)2 (3)

Complex 3 was prepared by a similar procedure as described for 1, with the exception that pdbmb (0.0065g, 0.02mmol) was used instead of pzbmb (0.0065g, 0.02mmol). Yield: 70% (based on pdbmb). Elemental analysis (%) Anal. Calc. for C19H14Cl2N6Pt: C, 38.53; H, 2.38; N, 14.19. Found: C, 38.60; H, 2.51; N, 14.03%. IR (KBr/pellet, cm-1): 3073(w), 2164(w), 1611(w), 1480(s), 1453(s), 1350(m), 1288(m), 1161(w), 1137(s), 974(m), 779(s), 679(m).
